organizations: NFC East rival New York Giants Post
title: Dallas Cowboys week seven preview
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Dallas Cowboys week seven preview The Dallas Cowboys come out of their bye week looking to pick up a win against the NFC East rival New York Giants Post to Facebook Dallas Cowboys week seven preview The Dallas Cowboys come out of their bye week looking to pick up a win against the NFC East rival New York Giants   WFAA.com: http://on.wfaa.com/1LUfGxx   Join the Conversation To   Dallas Cowboys week seven preview Eddie Middlebrook, WFAA Sports 9:42 a.m. CDT October 24, 2015 How the Dallas Cowboys stack up against the New York Giants ahead of Sunday's Week 7 NFC East battle Dallas Cowboys tight end Gavin Escobar (89) scores a touchdown in the third quarter (Photo: Tim Heitman, Tim Heitman-USA TODAY Sports) 
Kickoff : 3:25 p.m., MetLife Stadium 
TV : 3:25 p.m., FOX 
Radio : Noon, 105.3 The Fan 
Records : Dallas 2-3, New York 3-3 
Series : Cowboys lead, 62-43-2 
Last meeting : Dallas, 27-26 (2015, in Arlington) 
Betting line : Giants -4 
Weather : 65 degrees, 60% chance of rain 
The Cowboys have made major changes at quarterback, running back and left guard with the bye week to prepare and get healthy. After starting 0-2, the Giants have now won three of four. Let's see how these two teams match-up: 
Dallas offense vs. New York defense 
So much has changed for this offense within the last week much less since Week 1 against the Giants. Out is Brandon Weeden and Ron Leary while former Aggie Christine Michael is now going to see more action in the running game. 
What do we expect from Matt Cassel? Look for Cassel to be a more polished quarterback than Weeden. When the Cowboys gave up a draft pick to get Cassel you know it was just a matter of time before he saw the field. Weeden was Mr. Check Down and that was definitely evident in the New England game as he threw for only 187 yards on 39 attempts. Cassel is a veteran that has some success in this league which is something Weeden can't say. 
The running game wasn't terrible against the Patriots, but there is no question that it needs a shot in the arm and that will happen with La'el Collins in for Leary on the line and Michael in the backfield. Michael didn't see a lot of action in Seattle the last two seasons, but he did average 4.8 yards per carry. 
The Giants defense picked off Sam Bradford three times and recovered a fumble, but allowed 158 rushing yards and 27 points to the Eagles. Overall, this defense ranks 28th in total defense and 30th against the pass. 
Despite giving up a lot of yards to DeMarco Murray and Co., the rushing defense for New York ranks seventh in the NFL as they only allow 93.5 yards per game. Their led by Linebacker Uani' Unga who has 42 tackles and two interceptions on the season. The absence of Jason Pierre-Paul is felt on this defensive line as they only have eight sacks on the season which is tied for 28th in the league. 
A lot of question marks on the Cowboys offense which will make this battle closer than it should be. 
Edge: PUSH 
Dallas defense vs. New York offense 
The Cowboys defense did limit the Patriots to their second-lowest output of the season and are now fully healthy on the defensive line for the first time on the year as they welcome rookie Randy Gregory back to the fold. All-Pro Defensive End Greg Hardy made his presence felt in his debut game as he had two sacks and five hits on Tom Brady. 
Overall, this Cowboys defense ranks 12th in total defense. They rank 17th against the pass and 10th against the run. Four players are tied for the team lead in sacks with two including Hardy. The Cowboys only have two interceptions on the season which is tied for 30th in the NFL. 
Eli Manning has limited his turnovers this season as he has four interceptions to 11 touchdowns. His 94 QB rating ranks 13th and he is top 10 in yards and touchdowns so far in 2015. Manning is coming off his worst performance of the season as he threw two picks and was sacked three times by the Eagles. 
The Giants running game has been terrible this season as they average 3.6 yards per carry as a unit and only have two touchdowns. Odell Beckham Jr. is always dangerous as the primary receiver, but he was limited to five catches for 44 yards in the Week 1 match-up. 
Edge: DALLAS 
Key match-up 
Eli Manning vs. Cowboys defensive line: Manning has been only sacked seven times this season, but three of those game in last week's loss to the Eagles. He was only sacked once in the first match-up with Dallas, but the Cowboys didn't have Hardy playing and Gregory was in his first game as a rookie. Look for the Boys to pressure Manning all afternoon. 
Edge: DALLAS 
Special teams 
Kicker Dan Bailey is perfect on all eight attempts this season. Kick Returner Lucky Whitehead returned a kick against the Patriots for 21 yards and had minus two yards on his one punt return. 
Giants Kicker Josh Brown is 13-13 so far this season including six from 40+ yards. Former Cowboy Dwayne Harris has provided a boost to their return game as he averaged 27.8 yards per kickoff and 7.4 yards per punt return. 
Edge: NEW YORK 
Intangibles 
Both teams are coming off blowout losses, but Dallas has had an extra week to prepare for this game. There is a big difference between 3-3 and 2-4 for this Dallas team that still has Super Bowl aspirations as Tony Romo alluded to last week when meeting Tom Brady after the game. 
Edge: DALLAS 
The Cowboys have won eight straight against NFC East foes. 
Prediction : Dallas 24, New York 21 
Eddie Middlebrook can be reached on Twitter @emiddlebrook . Read or Share this story: http://on.wfaa.com/1LUfGxx TOP VIDEOS
